item.description:
Theme: never again

could be third time’s a charm, worst boss ever, road trip from hell, a starter marriage or shoes too small? You made the vow, it was NOT happening to you again!

JAN 22, 2012 venue TBA

Come to listen as people from all walks of life tell 5 minute true stories on the night’s theme...Or bring your own 1st person story to tell.

10 people are chosen at random to tell each night. WSU students with a story get in free!

Winners advance to the semifinals with a shot at place in the BigMouthOff in Boston.

Host: Julius Jones

What's a story slam?

Modeled after poetry slams, massmouth’s story slams invite storytellers—from experienced performers to first-timers—to share a real-life story in five minutes.  Storytellers sign up and 10 are chosen at random to tell their story on the slam's theme. Volunteer judges award prizes based on a story’s narrative arc, presentation and connection to the theme. Judges select first and second place winners and the audience votes for a third. Winners are invited back for the semi-finals in March, where they vie for a spot in the finals.

NOTE:  This year (2013), Story Slam Finals (also known as the Big Mouth Off) will take place on April 17th at the Coolidge Corner Theater in Brookline!

 

More at event pages at massmouth.com

This program is supported in part by a grant from the Worcester Arts Council, a local, independent agent of the Massachusetts Cultural Council.

 

online: massmouth.com/events • massmouth.blogspot.com •
masssmouth.org. • You can join @ massmouth.com to get updates & info on live performances & events and massmouth membership is free!

TEL: 617-942-2553 EMAIL: stories@massmouth.com OFFICE: 42 Seaverns Ave, JP 02130

& Worcester slam crew contact: worcester@massmouth.com

group.name: Greater Boston and MA Storytelling Meetup Group
